pageContext.description: Five from same mould.,  Plain & looped.
pageContext.other: Elegant 3-part, hand-drawn illustration with a few dimensions.  One part is a cross-section., Under SITE, two lines have been whited out, and 'GREATER LONDON, Bexley Heath" have been written over the white-out.
pageContext.associations: 1-29; 21 Socketed Celts; 16 Fragments Celts; 1 Chisel? 1 Knife; 1 Gouge; 1 Spearhead; 1 Sword; 1 Copper cake, Fragments cake
pageContext.rightCorner: RED DOT,  FOLLOWED BY:  "U II 2"  OR "U II z",  NOTATED IN PENCIL
pageContext.site: England, GREATER LONDON,  Bexley Heath,  Discovered in a sandpit belonging to Mrs. Busely in 1930, at a depth of 15-20 ft from the surface, Founder's hoard.
pageContext.remarks: IN PENCIL, LEFT LOWER CORNER:,  "Almost OK", AT BOTTOM OF LEFT COLUMN:,  "N.D. 1974"
